guide.introduction:
Don the Heathers Red Scrunchie of Power

Make each of your guests feel like the queen bee by whipping up a bunch of these easy and economical '80s hair accessories. Then you can all rock ponytails just like the Heathers'.

You’ll need:

Red fabric 6" wide x 20" long

Braided elastic 1" wide x 10" long

Red thread

Sewing machine or hand sewing needle

Scissors

Safety pin

Instructions:

1. Fold the fabric (right side in) so it measures 3" wide x 20" long.

2. Stitch 1/4" away from the raw edge by hand or sewing machine.

3. Turn the tube inside out so that the right side of the fabric is visible with the seam on the inside.

4. Attach the safety pin to one end of the elastic. Use it to pull the elastic through the tube holding onto the the opposite end. Elastic should protrude from both ends. Scrunch down the fabric.

5. Overlap both elastic ends 1". Do not twist.

6. Stitch the ends together.

7. Fold one edge of the fabric tube under to make a hem approximately 1/4".

8. Pull the finished edge over the raw edge. Overlap at least 1".

9. Sew the tube closed. If sewing by machine, be sure the elastic is centered in the tube before stitching into place.
